question_text: A 28-year-old man is evaluated for the skin lesions shown. He is found to be HIV positive.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient's skin lesions?
critique: This patient most likely has Kaposi sarcoma (Option A). Lesions can present as erythematous or violaceous macules or larger nodules and plaques that may ulcerate. Early lesions may be characterized by palpable nodules that occur before skin discoloration develops. Common sites include the face, trunk, and lower extremities. Kaposi sarcoma is caused by human herpesvirus type 8 and occurs almost exclusively in persons with HIV infection (most commonly in men who have sex with men).
